6#ifndef GLSLANG_SHADERLANG_H_
7#define GLSLANG_SHADERLANG_H_
8
9#include <stddef.h>
10
11#include "KHR/khrplatform.h"
12
13#include <array>
14#include <map>
15#include <set>
16#include <string>
17#include <vector>
18
19//
20// This is the platform independent interface between an OGL driver
21// and the shading language compiler.
22//
23
24// Note: make sure to increment ANGLE_SH_VERSION when changing ShaderVars.h
25#include "ShaderVars.h"
26
27// Version number for shader translation API.
28// It is incremented every time the API changes.
29#define ANGLE_SH_VERSION 239
30
31enum ShShaderSpec
32{
33 SH_GLES2_SPEC,
34 SH_WEBGL_SPEC,
35
36 SH_GLES3_SPEC,
37 SH_WEBGL2_SPEC,
38
39 SH_GLES3_1_SPEC,
40 SH_WEBGL3_SPEC,
41
42 SH_GL_CORE_SPEC,
43 SH_GL_COMPATIBILITY_SPEC,
44};
45
46enum ShShaderOutput
47{
48 // ESSL output only supported in some configurations.
49 SH_ESSL_OUTPUT = 0x8B45,
50
51 // GLSL output only supported in some configurations.
52 SH_GLSL_COMPATIBILITY_OUTPUT = 0x8B46,
53 // Note: GL introduced core profiles in 1.5.
54 SH_GLSL_130_OUTPUT = 0x8B47,
55 SH_GLSL_140_OUTPUT = 0x8B80,
56 SH_GLSL_150_CORE_OUTPUT = 0x8B81,
57 SH_GLSL_330_CORE_OUTPUT = 0x8B82,
58 SH_GLSL_400_CORE_OUTPUT = 0x8B83,
59 SH_GLSL_410_CORE_OUTPUT = 0x8B84,
60 SH_GLSL_420_CORE_OUTPUT = 0x8B85,
61 SH_GLSL_430_CORE_OUTPUT = 0x8B86,
62 SH_GLSL_440_CORE_OUTPUT = 0x8B87,
63 SH_GLSL_450_CORE_OUTPUT = 0x8B88,
64
65 // Prefer using these to specify HLSL output type:
66 SH_HLSL_3_0_OUTPUT = 0x8B48, // D3D 9
67 SH_HLSL_4_1_OUTPUT = 0x8B49, // D3D 11
68 SH_HLSL_4_0_FL9_3_OUTPUT = 0x8B4A, // D3D 11 feature level 9_3
69
70 // Output specialized GLSL to be fed to glslang for Vulkan SPIR.
71 SH_GLSL_VULKAN_OUTPUT = 0x8B4B,
72
73 // Output specialized GLSL to be fed to glslang for Vulkan SPIR to be cross compiled to Metal
74 // later.
75 SH_GLSL_METAL_OUTPUT = 0x8B4C,
76
77 // Output for MSL
78 SH_MSL_METAL_OUTPUT = 0x8B4D,
79};
80
81// Compile options.
82// The Compile options type is defined in ShaderVars.h, to allow ANGLE to import the ShaderVars
83// header without needing the ShaderLang header. This avoids some conflicts with glslang.
84
85const ShCompileOptions SH_VALIDATE = 0;
86const ShCompileOptions SH_VALIDATE_LOOP_INDEXING = UINT64_C(1) << 0;
87const ShCompileOptions SH_INTERMEDIATE_TREE = UINT64_C(1) << 1;
88const ShCompileOptions SH_OBJECT_CODE = UINT64_C(1) << 2;
89const ShCompileOptions SH_VARIABLES = UINT64_C(1) << 3;
90const ShCompileOptions SH_LINE_DIRECTIVES = UINT64_C(1) << 4;
91const ShCompileOptions SH_SOURCE_PATH = UINT64_C(1) << 5;
92
93// This flag will keep invariant declaration for input in fragment shader for GLSL >=4.20 on AMD.
94// From GLSL >= 4.20, it's optional to add invariant for fragment input, but GPU vendors have
95// different implementations about this. Some drivers forbid invariant in fragment for GLSL>= 4.20,
96// e.g. Linux Mesa, some drivers treat that as optional, e.g. NVIDIA, some drivers require invariant
97// must match between vertex and fragment shader, e.g. AMD. The behavior on AMD is obviously wrong.
98// Remove invariant for input in fragment shader to workaround the restriction on Intel Mesa.
99// But don't remove on AMD Linux to avoid triggering the bug on AMD.
100const ShCompileOptions SH_DONT_REMOVE_INVARIANT_FOR_FRAGMENT_INPUT = UINT64_C(1) << 6;
101
102// Due to spec difference between GLSL 4.1 or lower and ESSL3, some platforms (for example, Mac OSX
103// core profile) require a variable's "invariant"/"centroid" qualifiers to match between vertex and
104// fragment shader. A simple solution to allow such shaders to link is to omit the two qualifiers.
105// AMD driver in Linux requires invariant qualifier to match between vertex and fragment shaders,
106// while ESSL3 disallows invariant qualifier in fragment shader and GLSL >= 4.2 doesn't require
107// invariant qualifier to match between shaders. Remove invariant qualifier from vertex shader to
108// workaround AMD driver bug.
109// Note that the two flags take effect on ESSL3 input shaders translated to GLSL 4.1 or lower and to
110// GLSL 4.2 or newer on Linux AMD.
111// TODO(zmo): This is not a good long-term solution. Simply dropping these qualifiers may break some
112// developers' content. A more complex workaround of dynamically generating, compiling, and
113// re-linking shaders that use these qualifiers should be implemented.
114const ShCompileOptions SH_REMOVE_INVARIANT_AND_CENTROID_FOR_ESSL3 = UINT64_C(1) << 7;
115
116// This flag works around bug in Intel Mac drivers related to abs(i) where
117// i is an integer.
118const ShCompileOptions SH_EMULATE_ABS_INT_FUNCTION = UINT64_C(1) << 8;
119
120// Enforce the GLSL 1.017 Appendix A section 7 packing restrictions.
121// This flag only enforces (and can only enforce) the packing
122// restrictions for uniform variables in both vertex and fragment
123// shaders. ShCheckVariablesWithinPackingLimits() lets embedders
124// enforce the packing restrictions for varying variables during
125// program link time.
126const ShCompileOptions SH_ENFORCE_PACKING_RESTRICTIONS = UINT64_C(1) << 9;
127
128// This flag ensures all indirect (expression-based) array indexing
129// is clamped to the bounds of the array. This ensures, for example,
130// that you cannot read off the end of a uniform, whether an array
131// vec234, or mat234 type. The ShArrayIndexClampingStrategy enum,
132// specified in the ShBuiltInResources when constructing the
133// compiler, selects the strategy for the clamping implementation.
134// TODO(http://anglebug.com/4361): fix for compute shaders.
135const ShCompileOptions SH_CLAMP_INDIRECT_ARRAY_BOUNDS = UINT64_C(1) << 10;
136
137// This flag limits the complexity of an expression.
138const ShCompileOptions SH_LIMIT_EXPRESSION_COMPLEXITY = UINT64_C(1) << 11;
139
140// This flag limits the depth of the call stack.
141const ShCompileOptions SH_LIMIT_CALL_STACK_DEPTH = UINT64_C(1) << 12;
142
143// This flag initializes gl_Position to vec4(0,0,0,0) at the
144// beginning of the vertex shader's main(), and has no effect in the
145// fragment shader. It is intended as a workaround for drivers which
146// incorrectly fail to link programs if gl_Position is not written.
147const ShCompileOptions SH_INIT_GL_POSITION = UINT64_C(1) << 13;
148
149// This flag replaces
150// "a && b" with "a ? b : false",
151// "a || b" with "a ? true : b".
152// This is to work around a MacOSX driver bug that |b| is executed
153// independent of |a|'s value.
154const ShCompileOptions SH_UNFOLD_SHORT_CIRCUIT = UINT64_C(1) << 14;
155
156// This flag initializes output variables to 0 at the beginning of main().
157// It is to avoid undefined behaviors.
158const ShCompileOptions SH_INIT_OUTPUT_VARIABLES = UINT64_C(1) << 15;
159
160// This flag scalarizes vec/ivec/bvec/mat constructor args.
161// It is intended as a workaround for Linux/Mac driver bugs.
162const ShCompileOptions SH_SCALARIZE_VEC_AND_MAT_CONSTRUCTOR_ARGS = UINT64_C(1) << 16;
163
164// This flag overwrites a struct name with a unique prefix.
165// It is intended as a workaround for drivers that do not handle
166// struct scopes correctly, including all Mac drivers and Linux AMD.
167const ShCompileOptions SH_REGENERATE_STRUCT_NAMES = UINT64_C(1) << 17;
168
169// This flag makes the compiler not prune unused function early in the
170// compilation process. Pruning coupled with SH_LIMIT_CALL_STACK_DEPTH
171// helps avoid bad shaders causing stack overflows.
172const ShCompileOptions SH_DONT_PRUNE_UNUSED_FUNCTIONS = UINT64_C(1) << 18;
173
174// This flag works around a bug in NVIDIA 331 series drivers related
175// to pow(x, y) where y is a constant vector.
176const ShCompileOptions SH_REMOVE_POW_WITH_CONSTANT_EXPONENT = UINT64_C(1) << 19;
177
178// This flag works around bugs in Mac drivers related to do-while by
179// transforming them into an other construct.
180const ShCompileOptions SH_REWRITE_DO_WHILE_LOOPS = UINT64_C(1) << 20;
181
182// This flag works around a bug in the HLSL compiler optimizer that folds certain
183// constant pow expressions incorrectly. Only applies to the HLSL back-end. It works
184// by expanding the integer pow expressions into a series of multiplies.
185const ShCompileOptions SH_EXPAND_SELECT_HLSL_INTEGER_POW_EXPRESSIONS = UINT64_C(1) << 21;
186
187// Flatten "#pragma STDGL invariant(all)" into the declarations of
188// varying variables and built-in GLSL variables. This compiler
189// option is enabled automatically when needed.
190const ShCompileOptions SH_FLATTEN_PRAGMA_STDGL_INVARIANT_ALL = UINT64_C(1) << 22;
191
192// Some drivers do not take into account the base level of the texture in the results of the
193// HLSL GetDimensions builtin. This flag instructs the compiler to manually add the base level
194// offsetting.
195const ShCompileOptions SH_HLSL_GET_DIMENSIONS_IGNORES_BASE_LEVEL = UINT64_C(1) << 23;
196
197// This flag works around an issue in translating GLSL function texelFetchOffset on
198// INTEL drivers. It works by translating texelFetchOffset into texelFetch.
199const ShCompileOptions SH_REWRITE_TEXELFETCHOFFSET_TO_TEXELFETCH = UINT64_C(1) << 24;
200
201// This flag works around condition bug of for and while loops in Intel Mac OSX drivers.
202// Condition calculation is not correct. Rewrite it from "CONDITION" to "CONDITION && true".
203const ShCompileOptions SH_ADD_AND_TRUE_TO_LOOP_CONDITION = UINT64_C(1) << 25;
204
205// This flag works around a bug in evaluating unary minus operator on integer on some INTEL
206// drivers. It works by translating -(int) into ~(int) + 1.
207const ShCompileOptions SH_REWRITE_INTEGER_UNARY_MINUS_OPERATOR = UINT64_C(1) << 26;
208
209// This flag works around a bug in evaluating isnan() on some INTEL D3D and Mac OSX drivers.
210// It works by using an expression to emulate this function.
211const ShCompileOptions SH_EMULATE_ISNAN_FLOAT_FUNCTION = UINT64_C(1) << 27;
212
213// This flag will use all uniforms of unused std140 and shared uniform blocks at the
214// beginning of the vertex/fragment shader's main(). It is intended as a workaround for Mac
215// drivers with shader version 4.10. In those drivers, they will treat unused
216// std140 and shared uniform blocks' members as inactive. However, WebGL2.0 based on
217// OpenGL ES3.0.4 requires all members of a named uniform block declared with a shared or std140
218// layout qualifier to be considered active. The uniform block itself is also considered active.
219const ShCompileOptions SH_USE_UNUSED_STANDARD_SHARED_BLOCKS = UINT64_C(1) << 28;
220
221// This flag works around a bug in unary minus operator on float numbers on Intel
222// Mac OSX 10.11 drivers. It works by translating -float into 0.0 - float.
223const ShCompileOptions SH_REWRITE_FLOAT_UNARY_MINUS_OPERATOR = UINT64_C(1) << 29;
224
225// This flag works around a bug in evaluating atan(y, x) on some NVIDIA OpenGL drivers.
226// It works by using an expression to emulate this function.
227const ShCompileOptions SH_EMULATE_ATAN2_FLOAT_FUNCTION = UINT64_C(1) << 30;
228
229// Set to initialize uninitialized local and global temporary variables. Should only be used with
230// GLSL output. In HLSL output variables are initialized regardless of if this flag is set.
231const ShCompileOptions SH_INITIALIZE_UNINITIALIZED_LOCALS = UINT64_C(1) << 31;
232
233// The flag modifies the shader in the following way:
234// Every occurrence of gl_InstanceID is replaced by the global temporary variable InstanceID.
235// Every occurrence of gl_ViewID_OVR is replaced by the varying variable ViewID_OVR.
236// At the beginning of the body of main() in a vertex shader the following initializers are added:
237// ViewID_OVR = uint(gl_InstanceID) % num_views;
238// InstanceID = gl_InstanceID / num_views;
239// ViewID_OVR is added as a varying variable to both the vertex and fragment shaders.
240const ShCompileOptions SH_INITIALIZE_BUILTINS_FOR_INSTANCED_MULTIVIEW = UINT64_C(1) << 32;
241
242// With the flag enabled the GLSL/ESSL vertex shader is modified to include code for viewport
243// selection in the following way:
244// - Code to enable the extension ARB_shader_viewport_layer_array/NV_viewport_array2 is included.
245// - Code to select the viewport index or layer is inserted at the beginning of main after
246// ViewID_OVR's initialization.
247// - A declaration of the uniform multiviewBaseViewLayerIndex.
248// Note: The SH_INITIALIZE_BUILTINS_FOR_INSTANCED_MULTIVIEW flag also has to be enabled to have the
249// temporary variable ViewID_OVR declared and initialized.
250const ShCompileOptions SH_SELECT_VIEW_IN_NV_GLSL_VERTEX_SHADER = UINT64_C(1) << 33;
251
252// If the flag is enabled, gl_PointSize is clamped to the maximum point size specified in
253// ShBuiltInResources in vertex shaders.
254const ShCompileOptions SH_CLAMP_POINT_SIZE = UINT64_C(1) << 34;
255
256// Turn some arithmetic operations that operate on a float vector-scalar pair into vector-vector
257// operations. This is done recursively. Some scalar binary operations inside vector constructors
258// are also turned into vector operations.
259//
260// This is targeted to work around a bug in NVIDIA OpenGL drivers that was reproducible on NVIDIA
261// driver version 387.92. It works around the most common occurrences of the bug.
262const ShCompileOptions SH_REWRITE_VECTOR_SCALAR_ARITHMETIC = UINT64_C(1) << 35;
263
264// Don't use loops to initialize uninitialized variables. Only has an effect if some kind of
265// variable initialization is turned on.
266const ShCompileOptions SH_DONT_USE_LOOPS_TO_INITIALIZE_VARIABLES = UINT64_C(1) << 36;
267
268// Don't use D3D constant register zero when allocating space for uniforms. This is targeted to work
269// around a bug in NVIDIA D3D driver version 388.59 where in very specific cases the driver would
270// not handle constant register zero correctly. Only has an effect on HLSL translation.
271const ShCompileOptions SH_SKIP_D3D_CONSTANT_REGISTER_ZERO = UINT64_C(1) << 37;
272
273// Clamp gl_FragDepth to the range [0.0, 1.0] in case it is statically used.
274const ShCompileOptions SH_CLAMP_FRAG_DEPTH = UINT64_C(1) << 38;
275
276// Rewrite expressions like "v.x = z = expression;". Works around a bug in NVIDIA OpenGL drivers
277// prior to version 397.31.
278const ShCompileOptions SH_REWRITE_REPEATED_ASSIGN_TO_SWIZZLED = UINT64_C(1) << 39;
279
280// Rewrite gl_DrawID as a uniform int
281const ShCompileOptions SH_EMULATE_GL_DRAW_ID = UINT64_C(1) << 40;
282
283// This flag initializes shared variables to 0.
284// It is to avoid ompute shaders being able to read undefined values that could be coming from
285// another webpage/application.
286const ShCompileOptions SH_INIT_SHARED_VARIABLES = UINT64_C(1) << 41;
287
288// Forces the value returned from an atomic operations to be always be resolved. This is targeted to
289// workaround a bug in NVIDIA D3D driver where the return value from
290// RWByteAddressBuffer.InterlockedAdd does not get resolved when used in the .yzw components of a
291// RWByteAddressBuffer.Store operation. Only has an effect on HLSL translation.
292// http://anglebug.com/3246
293const ShCompileOptions SH_FORCE_ATOMIC_VALUE_RESOLUTION = UINT64_C(1) << 42;
294
295// Rewrite gl_BaseVertex and gl_BaseInstance as uniform int
296const ShCompileOptions SH_EMULATE_GL_BASE_VERTEX_BASE_INSTANCE = UINT64_C(1) << 43;
297
298// Emulate seamful cube map sampling for OpenGL ES2.0. Currently only applies to the Vulkan
299// backend, as is done after samplers are moved out of structs. Can likely be made to work on
300// the other backends as well.
301const ShCompileOptions SH_EMULATE_SEAMFUL_CUBE_MAP_SAMPLING = UINT64_C(1) << 44;
302
303// This flag controls how to translate WEBGL_video_texture sampling function.
304const ShCompileOptions SH_TAKE_VIDEO_TEXTURE_AS_EXTERNAL_OES = UINT64_C(1) << 45;
305
306// If requested, validates the AST after every transformation. Useful for debugging.
307const ShCompileOptions SH_VALIDATE_AST = UINT64_C(1) << 46;
308
309// Use old version of RewriteStructSamplers, which doesn't produce as many
310// sampler arrays in parameters. This causes a few tests to pass on Android.
311const ShCompileOptions SH_USE_OLD_REWRITE_STRUCT_SAMPLERS = UINT64_C(1) << 47;
312
313// This flag works around a inconsistent behavior in Mac AMD driver where gl_VertexID doesn't
314// include base vertex value. It replaces gl_VertexID with (gl_VertexID + angle_BaseVertex)
315// when angle_BaseVertex is available.
316const ShCompileOptions SH_ADD_BASE_VERTEX_TO_VERTEX_ID = UINT64_C(1) << 48;
317
318// This works around the dynamic lvalue indexing of swizzled vectors on various platforms.
319const ShCompileOptions SH_REMOVE_DYNAMIC_INDEXING_OF_SWIZZLED_VECTOR = UINT64_C(1) << 49;
320
321// This flag works around a slow fxc compile performance issue with dynamic uniform indexing.
322const ShCompileOptions SH_ALLOW_TRANSLATE_UNIFORM_BLOCK_TO_STRUCTUREDBUFFER = UINT64_C(1) << 50;
323
324// This flag indicates whether Bresenham line raster emulation code should be generated. This
325// emulation is necessary if the backend uses a differnet algorithm to draw lines. Currently only
326// implemented for the Vulkan backend.
327const ShCompileOptions SH_ADD_BRESENHAM_LINE_RASTER_EMULATION = UINT64_C(1) << 51;
328
329// This flag allows disabling ARB_texture_rectangle on a per-compile basis. This is necessary
330// for WebGL contexts becuase ARB_texture_rectangle may be necessary for the WebGL implementation
331// internally but shouldn't be exposed to WebGL user code.
332const ShCompileOptions SH_DISABLE_ARB_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE = UINT64_C(1) << 52;
333
334// This flag works around a driver bug by rewriting uses of row-major matrices
335// as column-major in ESSL 3.00 and greater shaders.
336const ShCompileOptions SH_REWRITE_ROW_MAJOR_MATRICES = UINT64_C(1) << 53;
337
338// Drop any explicit precision qualifiers from shader.
339const ShCompileOptions SH_IGNORE_PRECISION_QUALIFIERS = UINT64_C(1) << 54;
340
341// Allow compiler to do early fragment tests as an optimization.
342const ShCompileOptions SH_EARLY_FRAGMENT_TESTS_OPTIMIZATION = UINT64_C(1) << 55;
343
344// Allow compiler to insert Android pre-rotation code.
345const ShCompileOptions SH_ADD_PRE_ROTATION = UINT64_C(1) << 56;
346
347// Insert explicit casts for float/double/unsigned/signed int on macOS 10.15 with Intel driver
348const ShCompileOptions SH_ADD_EXPLICIT_BOOL_CASTS = UINT64_C(1) << 57;
349
350// Defines alternate strategies for implementing array index clamping.
351enum ShArrayIndexClampingStrategy
352{
353 // Use the clamp intrinsic for array index clamping.
354 SH_CLAMP_WITH_CLAMP_INTRINSIC = 1,
355
356 // Use a user-defined function for array index clamping.
357 SH_CLAMP_WITH_USER_DEFINED_INT_CLAMP_FUNCTION
358};
359
360// The 64 bits hash function. The first parameter is the input string; the
361// second parameter is the string length.
362using ShHashFunction64 = khronos_uint64_t (*)(const char *, size_t);
363
364//
365// Implementation dependent built-in resources (constants and extensions).
366// The names for these resources has been obtained by stripping gl_/GL_.
367//
368struct ShBuiltInResources
369{
370 // Constants.
371 int MaxVertexAttribs;
372 int MaxVertexUniformVectors;
373 int MaxVaryingVectors;
374 int MaxVertexTextureImageUnits;
375 int MaxCombinedTextureImageUnits;
376 int MaxTextureImageUnits;
377 int MaxFragmentUniformVectors;
378 int MaxDrawBuffers;
379
380 // Extensions.
381 // Set to 1 to enable the extension, else 0.
382 int OES_standard_derivatives;
383 int OES_EGL_image_external;
384 int OES_EGL_image_external_essl3;
385 int NV_EGL_stream_consumer_external;
386 int ARB_texture_rectangle;
387 int EXT_blend_func_extended;
388 int EXT_draw_buffers;
389 int EXT_frag_depth;
390 int EXT_shader_texture_lod;
391 int WEBGL_debug_shader_precision;
392 int EXT_shader_framebuffer_fetch;
393 int NV_shader_framebuffer_fetch;
394 int NV_shader_noperspective_interpolation;
395 int ARM_shader_framebuffer_fetch;
396 int OVR_multiview;
397 int OVR_multiview2;
398 int EXT_multisampled_render_to_texture;
399 int EXT_multisampled_render_to_texture2;
400 int EXT_YUV_target;
401 int EXT_geometry_shader;
402 int EXT_gpu_shader5;
403 int EXT_shader_non_constant_global_initializers;
404 int OES_texture_storage_multisample_2d_array;
405 int OES_texture_3D;
406 int ANGLE_texture_multisample;
407 int ANGLE_multi_draw;
408 int ANGLE_base_vertex_base_instance;
409 int WEBGL_video_texture;
410 int APPLE_clip_distance;
411 int OES_texture_cube_map_array;
412 int EXT_texture_cube_map_array;
413 int EXT_shadow_samplers;
414 int OES_shader_multisample_interpolation;
415 int OES_shader_image_atomic;
416 int OES_texture_buffer;
417 int EXT_texture_buffer;
418
419 // Set to 1 to enable replacing GL_EXT_draw_buffers #extension directives
420 // with GL_NV_draw_buffers in ESSL output. This flag can be used to emulate
421 // EXT_draw_buffers by using it in combination with GLES3.0 glDrawBuffers
422 // function. This applies to Tegra K1 devices.
423 int NV_draw_buffers;
424
425 // Set to 1 if highp precision is supported in the ESSL 1.00 version of the
426 // fragment language. Does not affect versions of the language where highp
427 // support is mandatory.
428 // Default is 0.
429 int FragmentPrecisionHigh;
430
431 // GLSL ES 3.0 constants.
432 int MaxVertexOutputVectors;
433 int MaxFragmentInputVectors;
434 int MinProgramTexelOffset;
435 int MaxProgramTexelOffset;
436
437 // Extension constants.
438
439 // Value of GL_MAX_DUAL_SOURCE_DRAW_BUFFERS_EXT for OpenGL ES output context.
440 // Value of GL_MAX_DUAL_SOURCE_DRAW_BUFFERS for OpenGL output context.
441 // GLES SL version 100 gl_MaxDualSourceDrawBuffersEXT value for EXT_blend_func_extended.
442 int MaxDualSourceDrawBuffers;
443
444 // Value of GL_MAX_VIEWS_OVR.
445 int MaxViewsOVR;
446
447 // Name Hashing.
448 // Set a 64 bit hash function to enable user-defined name hashing.
449 // Default is NULL.
450 ShHashFunction64 HashFunction;
451
452 // Selects a strategy to use when implementing array index clamping.
453 // Default is SH_CLAMP_WITH_CLAMP_INTRINSIC.
454 ShArrayIndexClampingStrategy ArrayIndexClampingStrategy;
455
456 // The maximum complexity an expression can be when SH_LIMIT_EXPRESSION_COMPLEXITY is turned on.
457 int MaxExpressionComplexity;
458
459 // The maximum depth a call stack can be.
460 int MaxCallStackDepth;
461
462 // The maximum number of parameters a function can have when SH_LIMIT_EXPRESSION_COMPLEXITY is
463 // turned on.
464 int MaxFunctionParameters;
465
466 // GLES 3.1 constants
467
468 // texture gather offset constraints.
469 int MinProgramTextureGatherOffset;
470 int MaxProgramTextureGatherOffset;
471
472 // maximum number of available image units
473 int MaxImageUnits;
474
475 // maximum number of image uniforms in a vertex shader
476 int MaxVertexImageUniforms;
477
478 // maximum number of image uniforms in a fragment shader
479 int MaxFragmentImageUniforms;
480
481 // maximum number of image uniforms in a compute shader
482 int MaxComputeImageUniforms;
483
484 // maximum total number of image uniforms in a program
485 int MaxCombinedImageUniforms;
486
487 // maximum number of uniform locations
488 int MaxUniformLocations;
489
490 // maximum number of ssbos and images in a shader
491 int MaxCombinedShaderOutputResources;
492
493 // maximum number of groups in each dimension
494 std::array<int, 3> MaxComputeWorkGroupCount;
495 // maximum number of threads per work group in each dimension
496 std::array<int, 3> MaxComputeWorkGroupSize;
497
498 // maximum number of total uniform components
499 int MaxComputeUniformComponents;
500
501 // maximum number of texture image units in a compute shader
502 int MaxComputeTextureImageUnits;
503
504 // maximum number of atomic counters in a compute shader
505 int MaxComputeAtomicCounters;
506
507 // maximum number of atomic counter buffers in a compute shader
508 int MaxComputeAtomicCounterBuffers;
509
510 // maximum number of atomic counters in a vertex shader
511 int MaxVertexAtomicCounters;
512
513 // maximum number of atomic counters in a fragment shader
514 int MaxFragmentAtomicCounters;
515
516 // maximum number of atomic counters in a program
517 int MaxCombinedAtomicCounters;
518
519 // maximum binding for an atomic counter
520 int MaxAtomicCounterBindings;
521
522 // maximum number of atomic counter buffers in a vertex shader
523 int MaxVertexAtomicCounterBuffers;
524
525 // maximum number of atomic counter buffers in a fragment shader
526 int MaxFragmentAtomicCounterBuffers;
527
528 // maximum number of atomic counter buffers in a program
529 int MaxCombinedAtomicCounterBuffers;
530
531 // maximum number of buffer object storage in machine units
532 int MaxAtomicCounterBufferSize;
533
534 // maximum number of uniform block bindings
535 int MaxUniformBufferBindings;
536
537 // maximum number of shader storage buffer bindings
538 int MaxShaderStorageBufferBindings;
539
540 // maximum point size (higher limit from ALIASED_POINT_SIZE_RANGE)
541 float MaxPointSize;
542
543 // EXT_geometry_shader constants
544 int MaxGeometryUniformComponents;
545 int MaxGeometryUniformBlocks;
546 int MaxGeometryInputComponents;
547 int MaxGeometryOutputComponents;
548 int MaxGeometryOutputVertices;
549 int MaxGeometryTotalOutputComponents;
550 int MaxGeometryTextureImageUnits;
551 int MaxGeometryAtomicCounterBuffers;
552 int MaxGeometryAtomicCounters;
553 int MaxGeometryShaderStorageBlocks;
554 int MaxGeometryShaderInvocations;
555 int MaxGeometryImageUniforms;
556
557 // Subpixel bits used in rasterization.
558 int SubPixelBits;
559
560 // APPLE_clip_distance/EXT_clip_cull_distance constant
561 int MaxClipDistances;
562};
563
564//
565// ShHandle held by but opaque to the driver. It is allocated,
566// managed, and de-allocated by the compiler. Its contents
567// are defined by and used by the compiler.
568//
569// If handle creation fails, 0 will be returned.
570//
571using ShHandle = void *;
572
573namespace sh
574{
575
576//
577// Driver must call this first, once, before doing any other compiler operations.
578// If the function succeeds, the return value is true, else false.
579//
580bool Initialize();
581//
582// Driver should call this at shutdown.
583// If the function succeeds, the return value is true, else false.
584//
585bool Finalize();
586
587//
588// Initialize built-in resources with minimum expected values.
589// Parameters:
590// resources: The object to initialize. Will be comparable with memcmp.
591//
592void InitBuiltInResources(ShBuiltInResources *resources);
593
594//
595// Returns the a concatenated list of the items in ShBuiltInResources as a null-terminated string.
596// This function must be updated whenever ShBuiltInResources is changed.
597// Parameters:
598// handle: Specifies the handle of the compiler to be used.
599const std::string &GetBuiltInResourcesString(const ShHandle handle);
600
601//
602// Driver calls these to create and destroy compiler objects.
603//
604// Returns the handle of constructed compiler, null if the requested compiler is not supported.
605// Parameters:
606// type: Specifies the type of shader - GL_FRAGMENT_SHADER or GL_VERTEX_SHADER.
607// spec: Specifies the language spec the compiler must conform to - SH_GLES2_SPEC or SH_WEBGL_SPEC.
608// output: Specifies the output code type - for example SH_ESSL_OUTPUT, SH_GLSL_OUTPUT,
609// SH_HLSL_3_0_OUTPUT or SH_HLSL_4_1_OUTPUT. Note: Each output type may only
610// be supported in some configurations.
611// resources: Specifies the built-in resources.
612ShHandle ConstructCompiler(sh::GLenum type,
613 ShShaderSpec spec,
614 ShShaderOutput output,
615 const ShBuiltInResources *resources);
616void Destruct(ShHandle handle);
617
618//
619// Compiles the given shader source.
620// If the function succeeds, the return value is true, else false.
621// Parameters:
622// handle: Specifies the handle of compiler to be used.
623// shaderStrings: Specifies an array of pointers to null-terminated strings containing the shader
624// source code.
625// numStrings: Specifies the number of elements in shaderStrings array.
626// compileOptions: A mask containing the following parameters:
627// SH_VALIDATE: Validates shader to ensure that it conforms to the spec
628// specified during compiler construction.
629// SH_VALIDATE_LOOP_INDEXING: Validates loop and indexing in the shader to
630// ensure that they do not exceed the minimum
631// functionality mandated in GLSL 1.0 spec,
632// Appendix A, Section 4 and 5.
633// There is no need to specify this parameter when
634// compiling for WebGL - it is implied.
635// SH_INTERMEDIATE_TREE: Writes intermediate tree to info log.
636// Can be queried by calling sh::GetInfoLog().
637// SH_OBJECT_CODE: Translates intermediate tree to glsl or hlsl shader.
638// Can be queried by calling sh::GetObjectCode().
639// SH_VARIABLES: Extracts attributes, uniforms, and varyings.
640// Can be queried by calling ShGetVariableInfo().
641//
642bool Compile(const ShHandle handle,
643 const char *const shaderStrings[],
644 size_t numStrings,
645 ShCompileOptions compileOptions);
646
647// Clears the results from the previous compilation.
648void ClearResults(const ShHandle handle);
649
650// Return the version of the shader language.
651int GetShaderVersion(const ShHandle handle);
652
653// Return the currently set language output type.
654ShShaderOutput GetShaderOutputType(const ShHandle handle);
655
656// Returns null-terminated information log for a compiled shader.
657// Parameters:
658// handle: Specifies the compiler
659const std::string &GetInfoLog(const ShHandle handle);
660
661// Returns null-terminated object code for a compiled shader.
662// Parameters:
663// handle: Specifies the compiler
664const std::string &GetObjectCode(const ShHandle handle);
665
666// Returns a (original_name, hash) map containing all the user defined names in the shader,
667// including variable names, function names, struct names, and struct field names.
668// Parameters:
669// handle: Specifies the compiler
670const std::map<std::string, std::string> *GetNameHashingMap(const ShHandle handle);
671
672// Shader variable inspection.
673// Returns a pointer to a list of variables of the designated type.
674// (See ShaderVars.h for type definitions, included above)
675// Returns NULL on failure.
676// Parameters:
677// handle: Specifies the compiler
678const std::vector<sh::ShaderVariable> *GetUniforms(const ShHandle handle);
679const std::vector<sh::ShaderVariable> *GetVaryings(const ShHandle handle);
680const std::vector<sh::ShaderVariable> *GetInputVaryings(const ShHandle handle);
681const std::vector<sh::ShaderVariable> *GetOutputVaryings(const ShHandle handle);
682const std::vector<sh::ShaderVariable> *GetAttributes(const ShHandle handle);
683const std::vector<sh::ShaderVariable> *GetOutputVariables(const ShHandle handle);
684const std::vector<sh::InterfaceBlock> *GetInterfaceBlocks(const ShHandle handle);
685const std::vector<sh::InterfaceBlock> *GetUniformBlocks(const ShHandle handle);
686const std::vector<sh::InterfaceBlock> *GetShaderStorageBlocks(const ShHandle handle);
687sh::WorkGroupSize GetComputeShaderLocalGroupSize(const ShHandle handle);
688// Returns the number of views specified through the num_views layout qualifier. If num_views is
689// not set, the function returns -1.
690int GetVertexShaderNumViews(const ShHandle handle);
691// Returns true if compiler has injected instructions for early fragment tests as an optimization
692bool HasEarlyFragmentTestsOptimization(const ShHandle handle);
693
694// Returns true if the passed in variables pack in maxVectors followingthe packing rules from the
695// GLSL 1.017 spec, Appendix A, section 7.
696// Returns false otherwise. Also look at the SH_ENFORCE_PACKING_RESTRICTIONS
697// flag above.
698// Parameters:
699// maxVectors: the available rows of registers.
700// variables: an array of variables.
701bool CheckVariablesWithinPackingLimits(int maxVectors,
702 const std::vector<sh::ShaderVariable> &variables);
703
704// Gives the compiler-assigned register for a shader storage block.
705// The method writes the value to the output variable "indexOut".
706// Returns true if it found a valid shader storage block, false otherwise.
707// Parameters:
708// handle: Specifies the compiler
709// shaderStorageBlockName: Specifies the shader storage block
710// indexOut: output variable that stores the assigned register
711bool GetShaderStorageBlockRegister(const ShHandle handle,
712 const std::string &shaderStorageBlockName,
713 unsigned int *indexOut);
714
715// Gives the compiler-assigned register for a uniform block.
716// The method writes the value to the output variable "indexOut".
717// Returns true if it found a valid uniform block, false otherwise.
718// Parameters:
719// handle: Specifies the compiler
720// uniformBlockName: Specifies the uniform block
721// indexOut: output variable that stores the assigned register
722bool GetUniformBlockRegister(const ShHandle handle,
723 const std::string &uniformBlockName,
724 unsigned int *indexOut);
725
726bool ShouldUniformBlockUseStructuredBuffer(const ShHandle handle,
727 const std::string &uniformBlockName);
728
729// Gives a map from uniform names to compiler-assigned registers in the default uniform block.
730// Note that the map contains also registers of samplers that have been extracted from structs.
731const std::map<std::string, unsigned int> *GetUniformRegisterMap(const ShHandle handle);
732
733// Sampler, image and atomic counters share registers(t type and u type),
734// GetReadonlyImage2DRegisterIndex and GetImage2DRegisterIndex return the first index into
735// a range of reserved registers for image2D/iimage2D/uimage2D variables.
736// Parameters: handle: Specifies the compiler
737unsigned int GetReadonlyImage2DRegisterIndex(const ShHandle handle);
738unsigned int GetImage2DRegisterIndex(const ShHandle handle);
739
740// The method records these used function names related with image2D/iimage2D/uimage2D, these
741// functions will be dynamically generated.
742// Parameters:
743// handle: Specifies the compiler
744const std::set<std::string> *GetUsedImage2DFunctionNames(const ShHandle handle);
745
746bool HasValidGeometryShaderInputPrimitiveType(const ShHandle handle);
747bool HasValidGeometryShaderOutputPrimitiveType(const ShHandle handle);
748bool HasValidGeometryShaderMaxVertices(const ShHandle handle);
749GLenum GetGeometryShaderInputPrimitiveType(const ShHandle handle);
750GLenum GetGeometryShaderOutputPrimitiveType(const ShHandle handle);
751int GetGeometryShaderInvocations(const ShHandle handle);
752int GetGeometryShaderMaxVertices(const ShHandle handle);
753unsigned int GetShaderSharedMemorySize(const ShHandle handle);
754
755//
756// Helper function to identify specs that are based on the WebGL spec.
757//
758inline bool IsWebGLBasedSpec(ShShaderSpec spec)
759{
760 return (spec == SH_WEBGL_SPEC || spec == SH_WEBGL2_SPEC || spec == SH_WEBGL3_SPEC);
761}
762
763//
764// Helper function to identify DesktopGL specs
765//
766inline bool IsDesktopGLSpec(ShShaderSpec spec)
767{
768 return spec == SH_GL_CORE_SPEC || spec == SH_GL_COMPATIBILITY_SPEC;
769}
770
771// Can't prefix with just _ because then we might introduce a double underscore, which is not safe
772// in GLSL (ESSL 3.00.6 section 3.8: All identifiers containing a double underscore are reserved for
773// use by the underlying implementation). u is short for user-defined.
774extern const char kUserDefinedNamePrefix[];
775
776namespace vk
777{
778
779// Specialization constant ids
780enum class SpecializationConstantId : uint32_t
781{
782 LineRasterEmulation = 0,
783 SurfaceRotation = 1,
784
785 InvalidEnum = 2,
786 EnumCount = InvalidEnum,
787};

790extern const char kDefaultUniformsNameVS[];
791extern const char kDefaultUniformsNameTCS[];
792extern const char kDefaultUniformsNameTES[];
793extern const char kDefaultUniformsNameGS[];
794extern const char kDefaultUniformsNameFS[];
795extern const char kDefaultUniformsNameCS[];
796
797// Interface block and variable names containing driver uniforms
798extern const char kDriverUniformsBlockName[];
799extern const char kDriverUniformsVarName[];
800
801// Interface block array name used for atomic counter emulation
802extern const char kAtomicCountersBlockName[];
803
804// Line raster emulation varying
805extern const char kLineRasterEmulationPosition[];
806
807} // namespace vk
